pronunciation: CONFEDERATE, [Latin] United in a league; allied by treaty; engaged in a confederacy.These were confederate with Abram. Genesis 14:13.Syria is confederate with Ephraim. Isaiah 7:2.CONFED'ERATE, noun One who is united with others in a league; a person or nation engaged in a confederacy; an ally.CONFED'ERATE, verb intransitive [Latin]

definitions.text: To to join mutual contract covenant.By words men come to know one another's minds; these they covenant and colonies of America confederated 1775.Several States of Europe have sometimes confederated for mutual safety.CONFED'ERATE,
